Heading: Did serial killer spend time in an orphanage?
Did serial killer spend time in a foster home?
Was serial killer ever raised by a relative?
Did serial killer ever live with adopted family?
Did serial killer live with a step-parent?
Physically abused?
Value: Beaten by father with belt, starting approximately at 12 or 13 years old

Heading: Psychologically abused?
Value:
Sisters would lie to the parents about things Neal would do, so he would receive a beating 
Father would embarrass him in public (bars) as a teen Mother made it clear he was her favorite or “golden boy”

Heading: Sexually abused?
Value:
According to Neal, when he was approximately 13, a married women molested him 
Also as a teen, a church elder sexually abused him and then he was sexually abused while in the Army

Heading: Father’s occupation
Value: Chief warrant officer in the Air Force

Heading: Father abused drugs/alcohol
Value: 12 or 13 years old, father started to drink more heavily

Heading: Applied for job as a cop?
Employment status during series
Value: Unemployed, would steal and con others for money

Heading: Sexual preference
Value: Heterosexual (could have mix feeling about men; when he was married he tried to “test” wife with a threesome with other men)

Heading: Lives with his children
Value: No, did not spend any time with child

Heading: Animal torture
Value:
Yes 
Killed a cat with a fork 
Killed his girlfriend’s cat with nun chucks Killed a puppy by punching its brains in

Heading: Been to a psychologist (prior to killing)?
Time in forensic hospital (prior to killing)?
Killer Criminal History (Prior to the series)
Committed previous crimes?
Value: When he was 10-years old, he shoplifted from a local store with a friend. His parents were called but no arrest was made.

Heading: Number of victims (confessed to)
Value: 3 (Jackson (1999) claims Neal initially confessed to 500, but Neal denies that he confessed to that number)

Heading: Killer age at start of series
Killer age at end of series
Date of first kill in series
Date of final kill in series
Age of victims
Value: Rebecca Holberton (44 ), Candace Walters (48), Angela Fite (28)

Heading: Method of killing
Value: Blow to the head multiple times using a 7½  pound maul

Heading: Was gun used?
Value: There was a gun present for manipulation in Scott’s case, but no gun was used.

Heading: Type
Value: Handgun, but owned a shotgun as well.

Heading: Type of serial killer
Value: Organized was done for lust and control

Heading: How close did killer live?
Value: In a townhouse shared with Rebecca Holberton

Heading: Killing occurred in home of victim?
Killing occurred in home of killer?
Victim abducted or killed at contact?
Value: The 3 killed were tricked into being tied up and then quickly killed. Suzanne was bound and then kept abducted for about 2 days.

Heading: Tortured victims?
Value: No. Contrary to news reports, it does not seem that he tortured his murder victims and he says that he didn’t.

Heading: Used blindfold?
Value: Either blanket over the head or came up from behind

Heading: Mutilated body?
Value: Disconnected the skull from body; Urinated on victim

Heading: Posed the body?
Value: Yes, put Fite in a chair

Heading: Took totem – body part
Value: A piece of skull bone with hair attacked

Heading: Left at scene, no attempt to hide
Value: Fite was in view on a chair

Heading: Left at scene, hidden
Value: Holberton and Walters were put in plastic bags and tied up

Heading: Dumped body in lake, river, etc.
Sentence
Value: Initially sentenced to death but death sentence was overturned.

Heading: Did serial killer confess?
Value: Yes. (Jackson (1999) claims Neal initially confessed to 500, but Neal denies that he confessed to that number)

Heading: Killer committed suicide?
Value: No, but thought about it before being arrested
